channel.title: [CheezScape] Training teleport on magic tab
channel.description: For example when I click the training teleport (which I already have made). How can I make it so there are five different options on in a dialogue that I can click on and teleport me to specific places? Please help.

item.title: [CheezScape] Training teleport on magic tab
item.dc:creator: @dmannn0120 dmannn0120
item.description:
@dmannn0120 wrote:

[quote=“halflive9, post:2, topic:428631”]What base is it? But it probably will be something like:

sendQuest("text", id); and so on.[/quote]

Yes, here is what my code looks like for an npc dialogue…

case 1340: sendFrame126("What would you like to train on?", 2460); sendFrame126("Dwarves (1-25)", 2461); sendFrame126("Rock Crabs (25-60)", 2462); sendFrame126("Cyclops (60-85)", 2463); sendFrame126("Ice Giants (85-110)", 2464); sendFrame126("Hellhounds (110+)", 2465); sendFrame164(2459); NpcDialogueSend = true; break;

But when I click the npc to talk it, only the first two dialogue options are in the dialogue and work. How do I get the other three options to show in the dialogue, and how can I make the clicking work for all 5 options?

Team_Rocket:

You’ll need to find the frame for the lines of Dialogue interface, edit the lines of text according to what you want, and edit the clicking packets. I’ve never heard of “Cheez” base, so I’m unfamiliar with how the Dialogue system works.

Yeah sounds very familiar. Where are the clicking packets? Yeah the source, CheezScape.

Read full topic
